intro: Mariscus panamensis, commonly known as the Panama marshmallow, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, swampy environments and is often found near rivers and in marshy areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
